intro.title: What is Naegihaja?
intro.p1: Naegihaja is a free web game service that helps friends, couples, family, and coworkers fairly decide order, penalties, or who pays.
intro.p2: The name "Naegihaja" means "let‚Äôs make a bet" in Korean.
intro.p3: No installation or signup is required. You can use it instantly in any browser on mobile, tablet, or desktop.
intro.p4: Roulette, dice, ladder game, and bomb pick are gathered in one place to solve the simple question ‚Äî "Who should do it?" ‚Äî in the easiest and most fun way.

birth.title: How It Started
birth.p1: Naegihaja was born from everyday moments at work ‚Äî deciding who buys coffee, desserts, or takes turns paying for lunch.
birth.p2: Rock-paper-scissors kept ending in ties, took too long, and sometimes didn‚Äôt feel fair.
birth.p3: We needed a fast and transparent way to decide, so instead of searching different tools every time, we created one place with all decision games.

intro.title: What is the Ladder Game?
intro.p1: The ladder game is a traditional Korean drawing method used for ages. Enter participant names and result items, and randomly connected ladder paths determine who gets which result.
intro.p2: In Naegihaza's ladder game, participants click their own name to follow the path and discover their result ‚Äî creating suspense and fun until the very end. Supports 2 to 10 participants.

rules.title: Detailed Rules
items: Enter participant names and result items separately.
The number of participants and results must be equal.
Minimum 2 and maximum 10 participants allowed.
Press Start to automatically generate the ladder.
Click a name to follow its path and reveal the result.

tips.title: When to Use
items: Splitting into teams or forming groups
Assigning duties like cleaning or dishes
Distributing different penalties among participants
Allocating prizes or rewards to participants

items.q: Can the number of participants and results differ?
items.a: No, due to the nature of the ladder game, participants and results must be equal. Each participant corresponds to exactly one result.

items.q: Can I reveal all results at once?
items.a: Yes, press the 'Reveal All' button to see all participants' paths and results simultaneously.

items.q: Are ladder paths generated differently each time?
items.a: Yes, new ladder paths are randomly generated for each game, making results unpredictable.

intro.title: What is Bomb Pick?
intro.p1: Bomb Pick is a thrilling game where players take turns choosing from face-down cards to find the hidden bomb. The person who picks the bomb card becomes the penalty target.
intro.p2: Since no one knows the result until the card is flipped, every participant stays on edge throughout the game. It's perfect for livening up parties, gatherings, and drinking sessions.

rules.title: Detailed Rules
items: Enter participant names (2 to 10 people).
When started, cards equal to twice the number of participants are generated.
One bomb is hidden among the cards.
Participants take turns choosing one card each.
The participant who picks the bomb gets the penalty.

tips.title: When to Use
items: Selecting one person for a penalty with suspense
Livening up a drinking session
Playing penalty games at parties or gatherings
When you want a simple but thrilling bet

items.q: Is there always only one bomb?
items.a: Yes, there is always exactly one bomb per game, and its position is completely random.

items.q: How is the number of cards determined?
items.a: The card count is automatically set to twice the number of participants. For example, 5 participants means 10 cards.
Since the bomb's position is completely random, equal probability applies to all participants regardless of selection order.

intro.title: What is the Dice Game?
intro.p1: The dice game is a fair random game where each participant rolls two dice and compares total scores. The participant with the highest score is selected, and ties are also displayed.
intro.p2: Naegihaza's dice game provides realistic rolling animations for an immersive experience. It's ideal for determining order or making score-based bets.

rules.title: Detailed Rules
items: Enter participant names (2 to 100 people).
Press Start to go to the dice game screen.
Each participant presses Roll on their turn.
Rankings are determined by the sum of two dice (2‚Äì12 points).
After all participants roll, the highest scorer is selected.

tips.title: When to Use
items: Deciding order (highest score goes first)
Making score-based bets
Determining game turns
Getting quick results without physical dice

items.q: What happens if there's a tie?
items.a: Ties are shown on the result screen. You can play again with the same participants if needed.
Yes, each die is designed to produce values 1‚Äì6 with equal probability. It follows the same probability distribution as real dice.

items.q: Does rolling order affect the results?
items.a: No, each dice roll is an independent random event, so equal probability applies to all participants regardless of order.

steps: Each participant presses Roll on their turn

sections.title: Information We Collect
sections.content: Naegihaza does not require sign-up or login and does not directly collect personally identifiable information. Participant names entered in games are processed only within your browser and are not stored on our servers. However, we may collect anonymized usage statistics (page visits, browser type, device type, etc.) for service improvement and analytics.

sections.title: Cookies and Tracking
sections.content: Naegihaza may use cookies for service operation and advertising. Third-party advertising services such as Google AdSense may use their own cookies to provide personalized ads. You can disable cookies in your browser settings, but some features may be limited.

sections.title: Third-Party Services
sections.content: Naegihaza may use third-party services such as Google AdSense (advertising) and Google Analytics (traffic analysis). These services collect and process data according to their own privacy policies. Please refer to the respective service's privacy policy for details.

sections.title: Data Storage
sections.content: Naegihaza does not store your game data on servers. All game processing occurs within your browser, and data is automatically deleted when you close the page. Some user preferences such as language settings may be stored in your browser's local storage.

sections.title: Children's Privacy
sections.content: Naegihaza is not intended for children under 13 and does not intentionally collect personal information from children. If we become aware that a child under 13 has provided personal information, we will promptly delete such information.

intro.title: What is Roulette?
intro.p1: Roulette is the most intuitive and fun way to fairly select one person from a group. Enter participant names and they'll be evenly placed on a spinning wheel ‚Äî the name where the arrow stops is selected.
intro.p2: Naegihaza's roulette uses a completely random algorithm to guarantee equal selection probability for all participants. No app installation required ‚Äî use it directly in your browser with 2 to 100 participants.

rules.title: Detailed Rules
items: Enter participant names separated by commas or line breaks.
You can enter between 2 and 100 participants.
Press Start to go to the roulette wheel screen.
Press Spin and the wheel rotates at a random speed.
When the wheel stops, the participant the arrow points to is selected.

tips.title: When to Use
items: Deciding who pays for lunch or coffee
Choosing a presenter or meeting facilitator
Fairly selecting someone for a penalty
Picking one option from multiple choices like menus or places

items.a: Yes, Naegihaza's roulette uses a cryptographically secure random number generator to ensure completely random results. Equal probability is applied to all participants.

items.q: Can I play again with the same participants?
items.a: Yes, on the result screen, press the 'Same players' button to spin again with the same participants without re-entering names.
Yes, Naegihaza is built with responsive design and works identically on smartphones, tablets, and PCs.

intro.title: What is Breakout?
intro.p1: Breakout is a random winner game using the classic arcade game. Enter participant names and one block per person is created, each labeled with a participant's name.
intro.p2: The ball breaks blocks as it bounces around, and the name on the last surviving block becomes the winner. The suspense of not knowing whose block will survive makes it exciting.

rules.title: Detailed Rules
items: Enter participant names (2 to 40 people).
One block per participant is automatically created.
Each participant's name appears on an equal number of blocks.
Press Play and the ball bounces off walls, breaking blocks automatically.
The name on the last remaining block is the winner.

tips.title: When to Use
items: When you want to pick a winner in a fun way
When you want visual effects with your bet
When you want retro arcade vibes for decisions
When you want to liven up a party or gathering

items.a: Press Play and the ball moves automatically, bouncing off walls and blocks. Just sit back and watch!

items.q: How is the number of blocks determined?
items.a: One block is created per participant. For example, 5 people get 5 blocks, 30 people get 30 blocks.
Block positions are randomly shuffled and the ball physics engine determines the outcome, producing unpredictable and fair results.

intro.title: What is the Slot Machine?
intro.p1: The Slot Machine is a random selection game where a reel spins with participant names. Names scroll rapidly and gradually slow down until the reel stops on the winner.
intro.p2: The reel gradually slows and stops, building suspense until the final name is revealed. Supports 2 to 100 participants.

rules.title: Detailed Rules
items: Enter participant names (2 to 100 people).
Press Start to go to the slot machine screen.
Press Spin and the reel starts spinning.
Names scroll rapidly then gradually slow down until the reel stops.
Once the reel stops, the winner is announced.

tips.title: When to Use
items: When you want a casino-style fun way to pick someone
When you want to liven up a party or gathering
When you want a suspenseful way to select a penalty target
When you want visual excitement with your bet

items.a: Yes, the winner is selected completely at random before the spin begins. Equal probability is applied to all participants.

items.q: Can I play again with the same participants?
items.a: Yes, press the 'Again' button on the result screen to spin again with the same participants.
The reel spins quickly then gradually slows to a natural stop. The result is unknown until the reel fully stops, keeping the suspense high.
